repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Somewhat fixes #6826.

I still believe we're better off encouraging people to use the standard libraries rather than writing completely agnostic Cython interfaces that handle all cases (including old compilers).

What I've done:
* Added warning comments that no-one will read.
* Created py_safe functions for locking that handle cases where they're called both with and without the GIL. This isn't completely universal (I haven't added them inside types for example) but I think there's enough to use most things correctly.
* Made sure that the C++ call_once py_safe functions reacquire the GIL around the callable. This just isn't possible in C because there's no state.

comment_data.body: I've come across evidence that says this may not actually be true. And that we can probably avoid this mess. But I need to investigate it first.

     int tss_create(tss_t* key, tss_dtor_t destructor)
     void *tss_get(tss_t key)
     int tss_set(tss_t key, void* val)
     void tss_delete(tss_t key)
+

+    """
+    static int __pyx_libc_threads_has_gil(PyGILState_STATE *gil_state) {
+        #if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API
+            /* There is no way to know if we have the GIL. Therefore the only

commit.message:
Add GIL-safe wrappers round many blocking C and C++ threading functions

Somewhat fixes #6826.

I still believe we're better off encouraging people to use the standard
libraries rather than writing completely agnostic Cython interfaces
that handle all cases (including old compilers).

What I've done:
* Added warning comments that no-one will read.
* Created py_safe functions for locking that handle cases where
  they're called both with and without the GIL. This isn't completely
  universal (I haven't added them inside types for example) but
  I think there's enough to use most things correctly.
* Made sure that the C++ call_once py_safe functions reacquire the
  GIL around the callable. This just isn't possible in C because
  there's no state.
